alert.note: Alert for Jasper (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:53AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River at Rensselaer affecting Jasper County. For the Iroquois River...including Rensselaer...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near Rensselaer downstream to near I-65 east of Foresman, including the Rensselaer gauge. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands begin. Flooding begins to backyards and a cemetery along the river. Flooding may also begin near Lairds Landing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to near 12.0 feet tomorrow morning. The river is expected to begin falling by the weekend. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected tonight.
